column4: Just replaced my 3GB of RAM with 4GB of RAM and on boot if I F2 into my system the bios shows 4GB of RAM but my Ubuntu 10.04  2.6.32-27-generic only shos 3.0GiB of Memory under system monitor... I have rebooted a few times... Whats Up?
bummer... so was that a wast of cash or will I see any improvement
Or you could update to 64bit OS..
I hardly doubt that.. Unles you're using pre 2002 hardware
I was going to do some Virtual Box stuff
Virtualising, How many VMs you plan on spawning, and what OS'es you plan on running
It depends on what you want to do on your host OS.
is there a command to get my system to return if it is 32/64... VB of Windows for testing and a few other projects
If your Host OS is windows and you plan on spawning multiple windows OS VMs then...... I'd say good luck
No I am running Ubuntu 10.04, want to VB a window in it... I don't have any windows boxs
Ifit's just that you hardly need more than the 3GB. unless you plan on running some silly resource hogging games in your windows VM
also I think uname -a should provide some info as to whether it's 32/64 bit
Yeah ignarps is a better solution.. Forgot about that command :D
It's cool if none of us ever forgot anything then we wouldn't need to chat here
We'd still have to chat. We of course come here to learn also
